description: In the late 1970s Brain Bolland left an indelible mark on the minds of many comic fans with his stunningly orginal, often controversial work on 2000AD's Judge Dredd. He went on to attract an even bigger audience with Camelot 3000 and Batman:The Killing Joke and remains a popular and much sought-after cover artist. This collection of short strips, on which Bolland is sole author, takes you away from the the guns and testosterone and into a world of wit and whimsy exclusively his own. The Actress and The Bishop stories take up the first half of the book, followed by the single page Mr. Mamoulian strips Bolland's alter ego taking a wry philosophical and very funny look at the world. The book is completed with assorted strips ranging from Fairy Tales to serious historical travelogue and some full page illustrations.
name: Bolland Strips!

description: An eclectic and stylish collection of comics from Rian Hughes, renowned illustrator and designer in a luxury embossed hardcover. All the stories here have been recoloured or relettered to show them at their best. Long before he discovered the Apple Mac, Hughes was collaborating with Eisner Award-winner Grant Morrison on the classic British character Dan Dare, producing a post-modern classic which sets an ageing, retired Dare against a modern British landscape he no longer understands. Versatile and unpredictable, Hughes makes full use of his clean graphic style on The Science Service, written by John Freeman, and a looser, moody noir palette on Raymond Chandler's Goldfish, here adapted by writer Tom DeHaven. Really & Truly, another Morrison collaboration, is a high-octane psychedelic road-trip torn from the pages of cult comic 2000AD. As well as sketchbook pages, merchandise and rare strips - many never seen before or out of print for over a decade - the book features an introduction by comics guru Paul Gravett.
name: Yesterday's Tomorrows

Yeah, we couldn't think of anything, either!

Award-winning cartoonist Chris Hastings teams up with Dark Horse Books to bring his smash-hit webcomic to print with the first three full-color story arcs of Dr. McNinja, as well as an exclusive-to-print story by Benito Cereno and Les McClaine.
name: The Adventures Of Dr. McNinja: Night Powers

description:
Proper Japanese Title: スケット・ダンス (Suketto Dansu) - is a manga series that is originally created by Kenta Shinohara. It first ran in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump on August 28, 2006. Then on November 2, 2007, Shueisha released the first tankobon volume. Sket Dance ended with a total of 288 chapters and 32 volumes. None of these volumes have been published in North America or Europe.

A Taiwanese edition published by Tong Li can be found here.
name: Sket Dance

description: This 226-page book contains the stories "Revenge of the Hundred Dead Ninja", "I Told You That Story So I Could Tell You This One", "Spooky Stuff" and "Punch Dracula" all previously published at drmcninja.com. It tells a tale so massive, it is nearly the size of the previous two volumes, combined. This book also has the print exclusive, never before seen 14 page comic, Beeman: A Death In The Family, written by Benito Cereno and illustrated by Anthony Clark. As with the previous volumes, all of the alt-text commentary has been preserved in the printing. The cover was made by the cultured and gracious Ms. Carly Monardo.

name: Eagle Annual

description:
This series launched with the return of legendary artist Joe Madureira (X-Men, Battle Chasers) and fan-favorite Spider-Man writer Zeb Wells in a brand new monthly Spider-series that teams the wall-crawler up with some of the greatest heroes in the Marvel Universe.

However Joe Madureira left the book after 3 issues and a rotating cast of artists illustrated each issue since, including Greg Land, Leinil Yu, Stuart Immonen and Marco Checchetto. Zeb Wells also left the series, this time after 6 issues, and again a rotating cast of writers were employed including Mark Waid and regular Amazing Spider-Man writer Dan Slott.

Issues #9 & #10 saw Kelly Sue DeConnick and Terry Dodson take over writing and art duties respectively. Both issues featured Carol Danvers and acted as the prologue to DeConnick's new Captain Marvel series.

Zeb Wells returned to write issue #11 which was a special 50th Anniversary issue. Following this the writer and artist rotations resumed with Kevin Shinick and Aaron Kuder writing and illustrating issues #12 & #13 and Cullen Bunn and Gabriele Dell'Otto taking over for issue #14 & #15.

Issue 15.1, which directly follows the hugely popular and controversial Amazing Spider-Man #700, saw the new regular writer and artist team of Christopher Yost and Paco Medina take over the series. From this issue onward, Avenging Spider-Man follows the adventures of the new Superior Spider-Man. Issue #16 also sees the series adopt the red Marvel NOW! banner.

The series was rebooted as Superior Spider-Man Team-Up after Doctor Octopus became the Superior Spider-Man.

Collected Editions

  • Spider-Man And Wolverine by Wells and Madureira (#1-3)
  • My Friends Can Beat Up Your Friends (#1-5)
  • Daredevil by Mark Waid vol. 3 (#6)
  • Punisher by Greg Rucka vol. 2 (#6)
  • Daredevil by Mark Waid Omnibus Volume 1 (#6)
  • Avenging Spider-Man: The Good, the Green and the Ugly (#7, 9-10 & 12-13)
  • Amazing Spider-Man: Ends of the Earth (#8)
  • Amazing Spider-Man: Big Time - The Complete Collection vol. 2 (#8)
  • Captain Marvel: Earth's Mightiest Hero Volume 2 (#9-10)
  • Amazing Spider-Man: Big Time - The Complete Collection vol. 4 (#11)
  • Spider-Man/Deadpool: Don't Call It A Team-Up (#12-13)
  • Avenging Spider-Man: Threats & Menaces (#14-15 & Annual #1)
  • Superior Spider-Man Team-Up: Superiority Complex (#15.1 and 16-19)
  • Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. vol. 1 (#20-21)
  • Superior Spider-Man Team-Up: Friendly Fire (#20-22)
name: Avenging Spider-Man

description:
"Don't set them up if you can't take them down!" Times may have changed since the days of the Old West, but in the war-torn South American state of San Diablo, the law of the gun still holds sway. When former hero-for-hire Maria Vasquez, alias Tarantula, finds herself wanted for murder south of the border, Texas Rangers Division lawman "Tex" Dawson is assigned to bring her in. But they're on a collision course with the outlaw Black Riders biker gang, who plan to make sure she never makes it to trial alive… Classic Marvel gunslingers Tarantula, Tex Dawson, Black Rider, Matt Slade and the Two-Gun Kid are given a modern-day makeover in this hard-bitten tale of blood and bullets by the DAREDEVIL: REBORN team of Andy Diggle and Davide Gianfelice. Five heroes, six guns…against six hundred!

Collected in Six Guns.
name: Six Guns

description:
X, the epic series from CLAMP, is now available in this deluxe collector’s edition. The pages have been recomposed in the original right-to-left reading order and restored to the highest quality. Each volume contains three of the original graphic novels, along with gorgeous, full-color illustrations never before published outside Japan!

Upcoming Releases

  • Volume 5 - January 8, 2013
name: X

description: A four part mini-series taking place after the events of Schism.
name: Magneto: Not A Hero

description:
A 3-D Graphic Novel by John Byrne.

The Caped Crusader leaped off the pages in all his red and blue glory in this over-sized 80 page special crafted by 3-D expert Ray Zone. Not only did this graphic novel feature an all-new tale written and illustrated by John Byrne, but it also reprinted the classic story, "The Robot Robbers" by Sheldon Moldoff and Curt Swan from the 1953 tome, Batman: Adventures in amazing 3-D Action, which featured 3-D effects by Jack Adler. Boasting a large cast of villains including the Penguin, the Riddler, Two-Face and teh Joker, the issue also featured eye-popping pin-ups by such luminaries as Mike Mignola, George Perez, Alex Toth, Barry Windsor -Smith and Art Adams, and a pair of punch-out bat-shaped 3-D glasses.
name: Batman 3-D

description:
The first of Marvel's Point One comics. Here are seven all-new stories that set the stage for everything coming your way in 2012 from the biggest names in the comics industry.

Comic Overview

Point One exhibits old and new artist impressions, showing classic old superheros and villains in their elements. First it starts in space were it describes the Watcher in his sphere. Where it is intruded two men. Through the archives they see all.
name: Point One

name: JLA Classified: New Maps of Hell
